channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Early voting for NYC's mayoral primary election begins this weekend
item.description: Eleven Democrats are running to replace New York City Mayor Eric Adams, who is running as an independent and bypassing the primary. Early voting for the primary election begins this weekend.

item.title: Here's what to expect for tomorrow's military parade
item.description: Saturday is the day of the big military parade in Washington. Amid the spectacle will be a jump by the Army's Golden Knights parachute team.

item.title: DHS missed alert on Boulder attacker
item.description: Mohammed Soliman tried to buy a gun to attack people in Boulder, Colo., who support Israeli hostages. His application was denied, and DHS was notified but did not follow up on that information.

item.title: Why the Catholic bishop of Nashville told Catholics they don't have to attend Mass
item.description: The Diocese of Nashville has told Catholics that they do not have to attend Mass if they fear for their safety. That's in response immigration actions taken by the Trump administration in the city.

item.title: A look ahead at the Club World Cup
item.description: The Club World Cup men's soccer tournament is set to kick off across the U.S. on Saturday, with some of the top teams around the world competing for a brand new trophy — and a whole lot of cash.

item.title: 5 years in, is the NBA's Basketball Africa League catching on with African fans?
item.description: The Basketball Africa League crowns a new champion this weekend, marking the venture's fifth anniversary. But can the NBA-backed league turn courtside glam and pan-African buzz into lasting success?

item.title: 'Death at the White Hart': When the publican is found dead, everyone's a suspect
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise talks with Chris Chibnall, author of Death at the White Hart.

item.title: What if being Mr. 305 was a state of mind?
item.description: Pitbull fans are honoring him the only way they know how: partying till dawn in bald caps and fake goatees.

item.title: Appliances face steel tariffs
item.description: Listen up if you're hoping to upgrade your kitchen: Tariffs are coming for your refrigerators, dishwashers and other home appliances.

item.title: Bruce the bat dog gets called up to the Major League
item.description: Most baseball legends get their start in the minor league. Bruce the Bat dog got the news this week that he's getting called up to the majors.
